action.name: action
action.description: The api module "action" to define user actions in ArangoDB.

admin.name: admin
admin.description: The api module to do administrative requests on Arango

aqlfunction.name: aqlfunction
aqlfunction.description: The api module "aqlfunction" to define user functions in ArangoDB.

batch.name: batch
batch.description:
The api module "batch" to perform batch requests. Calling "start" sets the connection into batch mode and collects
every request. Calling "Exec" switches back to normal mode and executes the batch.

collection.name: collection
collection.description: The api module to do perform operations on collections.

cursor.name: cursor
cursor.description: The api module to validate, test, execute arangodb queries and fetch the data..

database.name: database
database.description: The api module to perform database related operations on ArangoDB.

document.name: document
document.description: The api module to perform document related operations on ArangoDB.

edge.name: edge
edge.description: The api module to perform edge related operations on ArangoDB.

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: The api module to maintain endpoints in ArangoDB.

graph.name: graph
graph.description:
The api module to perform graph related operations on ArangoDB.

The underlying collections of the graph are still accessible using the standard methods for collections. 
However the graph module adds an additional layer on top of these collections giving you the following guarantees:

- All modifications are executed transactional
- If you delete a vertex all edges will be deleted, you will never have loose ends
- If you insert an edge it is checked if the edge matches the definition, your edge collections will only contain valid edges
These guarantees are lost if you access the collections in any other way than the graph module or AQL.

import.name: import
import.description: The api module to import data into ArangoDB.

index.name: index
index.description: The api module to create indices for collections in ArangoDB.

jobs.name: jobs
jobs.description: The api module to request information about async running jobs in ArangoDB.

query.name: query
query.description:
The api module to create and execute queries running in ArangoDB.
This module wraps the cursor module.

simple.name: simple
simple.description: The api module to do perform simple queries in ArangoDB.

transaction.name: transaction
transaction.description: The api module to execute transactions in ArangoDB.

traversal.name: traversal
traversal.description: The api module to perform a traversal on the edges of a start vertex.

users.name: users
users.description: The api module to maintain users in ArangoDB.

However the graph module adds an additional layer on top of these collections giving you the following guarantees:

- All modifications are executed transactional
- If you delete a vertex all edges will be deleted, you will never have loose ends
- If you insert an edge it is checked if the edge matches the definition, your edge collections will only contain valid edges
These guarantees are lost if you access the collections in any other way than the graph module or AQL.

classitems.description: Defines an action.

params.name: o
params.description: - Object containing the action mandatory and optional settings.

props.name: name
props.description: - The name of the action.

props.name: url
props.description: - The url of the action.

props.name: method
props.description: - The method of the action.

props.name: result
props.description: - A function called if a result has been returned.

props.name: error
props.description: - A function called if an error occured.

params.name: f
params.description: - A function to be executed on the server.

params.name: reload
params.description: - If true, the routes will be reloaded.

classitems.name: define

classitems.description: Executes an action and returns a promise.

params.name: actionName
params.description: - Name of the action to be executed.

classitems.name: submit

classitems.description: deletes an action and its route if existing.

params.name: actionName
params.description: - Name of the action to be executed.

classitems.name: undefine

classitems.description: returns all actions currently available.
classitems.name: getActions

classitems.description: Returns the server version

params.name: details
params.description: - If true more details are returned.

classitems.name: version

classitems.description: Returns server statistics.
classitems.name: statistics

classitems.description: Returns servers role. Possible values are "UNDEFINED", "COORDINATOR" or "PRIMARY".
classitems.name: role

classitems.description: Returns descriptions for server statistics.
classitems.name: statisticsDescription

classitems.description: Returns the server logs.

params.name: options
params.description: - Optional parameters and filters, can contain.

props.name: upto
props.description:
- Returns all log entries up to log level upto. Note that upto must be:
\- fatal or 0
- error or 1
- warning or 2
- info or 3
- debug or 4
The default value is info.

props.name: level
props.description:
- Returns all log entries of log level level. Note that the URL
parameters upto and level are mutually exclusive.

props.name: start
props.description:
- Returns all log entries such that their log entry identifier (lid
value) is greater or equal to start.

props.name: size
props.description: - Restricts the result to at most size log entries.

props.name: offset
props.description:
- Starts to return log entries skipping the first offset log entries.
offset and size can be used for pagination.

props.name: sort
props.description:
- Sort the log entries either ascending (if sort is asc) or descending
(if sort is desc) according to their lid values. Note that the lid imposes a chronological order. The default
value is asc

classitems.name: log

classitems.description: Returns the routes defined in ArangoDB,
classitems.name: routes

classitems.description: Reloads the routes in ArangoDB.
classitems.name: routesReload

classitems.description: Flushes the server modules.
classitems.name: modulesFlush

classitems.description: Returns the server time.
classitems.name: time

classitems.description:
The call returns an object with the following attributes:
- headers: a list of HTTP headers received \n
- requestType: the HTTP request method (e.g. GET)
- parameters: list of URL parameters received
classitems.name: echo

classitems.description: Flushes the server wal.

params.name: waitForSync
params.description: - Should wait if everything is synced to disk.

params.name: waitForCollector
params.description: - Should wait for the collector to execute.

classitems.name: modulesFlush

classitems.description: Creates a user defined AQL function.

params.name: isDeterministic
params.description:
-   boolean value to indicate that the function results are fully
deterministic.

classitems.name: create

classitems.description: Deletes a user defined AQL function.

params.name: group
params.description: - if set to true all functions in the namespace set in name will be deleted.

classitems.name: delete

classitems.description: Returns all user defined AQL functions.

params.name: namespace
params.description: - If set only functions in this namespace will be returned.

classitems.name: get

classitems.description: Enables the batch mode for the current connection.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: Disables the batch mode and executes the batch request.
classitems.name: exec

classitems.description: Disables the batch mode and rejects all requests in the current batch.
classitems.name: cancel

classitems.description: Creates a collection

props.name: waitForSync
props.description:
-    If true then the data is synchronised to disk before
returning from a create or update of a document.

props.name: doCompact
props.description: - whether or not the collection will be compacted.

props.name: type
props.description:
- the type of the collection to create. The following values for type are valid:
- 2: document collection
- 3: edges collection

props.name: journalSize
props.description: -   The maximal size of a journal or datafile. Must be at least 1MB.

props.name: isSystem
props.description:
If true, create a system collection. In this case collectionname
should start with an underscore. End users should normally create non-system collections only. API
implementors may be required to create system collections in very special occasions, but normally a regular
collection will do.

props.name: isVolatile
props.description:
If true then the collection data is kept in-memory only and not
made persistent. Unloading the collection will cause the collection data to be discarded. Stopping or
re-starting the server will also cause full loss of data in the collection. Setting this option will make the
resulting collection be slightly faster than regular collections because ArangoDB does not enforce any
synchronisation to disk and does not calculate any CRC checksums for datafiles.

props.name: numberOfShards
props.description: -   number of shards to distribute the collection on.

props.name: shardKeys
props.description: -   list of shard key attributes to use (e.g. [ "_key1", "_key2" ]).

props.name: keyOptions
props.description:
-   additional options for key generation. If specified, then keyOptions
should be a JSON array containing the following attributes:

props.name: type
props.description: "traditional" and "autoincrement".

props.name: allowUserKeys
props.description:
-    if set to true, then it is allowed to supply
own key values in the _key attribute of a document.

props.name: increment
props.description: -   increment value for autoincrement key generator.

props.name: offset
props.description: -   initial offset value for autoincrement key generator.

classitems.name: create

classitems.description: The result is an object describing the collection.
classitems.name: get

classitems.description: Deletes the collection.
classitems.name: delete

classitems.description: Deletes all documents of a collection.
classitems.name: truncate

classitems.description: Counts the document in the collection.
classitems.name: count

classitems.description: Result contains the number of documents and additional statistical information about the collection.
classitems.name: figures

classitems.description: Returns a list of all collections in the database.

params.name: excludeSystem
params.description: -    if set to true no system collections are returned.

classitems.name: list

classitems.description: Loads a collection into memory.
classitems.name: load

classitems.description: Deletes a collection from memory.
classitems.name: unload

classitems.description: Renames a collection.
classitems.name: rename

classitems.description: Result contains the waitForSync, doCompact, journalSize, and isVolatile properties.
classitems.name: getProperties

classitems.description: Changes the properties of a collection.

params.name: properties
params.description: - JSON Object that can contain each of the following:

props.name: waitForSync
props.description:
-  If true then creating or changing a document will wait
until the data has been synchronised to disk.

props.name: journalSize
props.description:
-   Size (in bytes) for new journal files that are created for the
collection.

classitems.name: setProperties

classitems.description:
Result contains the collection's revision id. The revision id is a server-generated string that clients can
use to check whether data in a collection has changed since the last revision check.
classitems.name: revision

classitems.description:
Will calculate a checksum of the meta-data (keys and optionally revision ids) and optionally the document
data in the collection.
The checksum can be used to compare if two collections on different ArangoDB instances contain the same
contents. The current revision of the collection is returned too so one can make sure the checksums are
calculated for the same state of data.

params.name: options
params.description: - JSON Object that can contain each of the following:

props.name: withRevisions
props.description:
-   If true, then revision ids (_rev system attributes) are
included in the checksumming.

props.name: withData
props.description:
-   If true, the user-defined document attributes will be
included in the calculation too.

classitems.name: checksum

classitems.description:
Rotates the journal of a collection. The current journal of the collection will be closed and made a read-only
datafile. The purpose of the rotate method is to make the data in the file available for compaction (compaction
is only performed for read-only datafiles, and not for journals).
classitems.name: rotate

classitems.description: Fetches data for a cursor.

params.name: id
params.description: -   The id of the cursor to fetch data for

classitems.name: get

classitems.description: Executes query string.

params.name: data
params.description: - A JSON Object containing the query data:

props.name: query
props.description: - contains the query string to be executed.

props.name: count
props.description:
-   boolean flag that indicates whether the number of documents in the
result set should be returned in the "count" attribute of the result.

props.name: batchSize
props.description:
-   maximum number of result documents to be transferred from the server
to the client in one roundtrip (optional). If this attribute is not set, a server-controlled default value
will be used.

props.name: bindVars
props.description: key/value list of bind parameters.

props.name: options
props.description: -   key/value list of extra options for the query

props.name: fullCount
props.description:
-   if set to true and the query contains a LIMIT clause,
then the result will contain an extra attribute extra with a sub-attribute fullCount. This sub-attribute will
contain the number of documents in the result before the last LIMIT in the query was applied. It can be used
to count the number of documents that match certain filter criteria, but only return a subset of them, in one
go.

classitems.name: create

classitems.description: Validates a query.

params.name: data
params.description: - A JSON Object containing the query data:

props.name: query
props.description: - contains the query string to be executed.

props.name: count
props.description:
-   boolean flag that indicates whether the number of documents in the
result set should be returned in the "count" attribute of the result.

props.name: batchSize
props.description:
-   maximum number of result documents to be transferred from the server
to the client in one roundtrip (optional). If this attribute is not set, a server-controlled default value
will be used.

props.name: bindVars
props.description: key/value list of bind parameters.

props.name: options
props.description: -   key/value list of extra options for the query

props.name: fullCount
props.description:
-   if set to true and the query contains a LIMIT clause,
then the result will contain an extra attribute extra with a sub-attribute fullCount. This sub-attribute will
contain the number of documents in the result before the last LIMIT in the query was applied. It can be used
to count the number of documents that match certain filter criteria, but only return a subset of them, in one
go.

params.name: data
params.description: - A JSON Object containing the query data:

props.name: query

props.name: count

props.name: bindVars

props.name: options
props.description: -   key/value list of extra options for the query

props.name: fullCount
props.description:
-   if set to true and the query contains a LIMIT clause,

props.description: -   Object containing additional user data.

classitems.description: creates a a document in a given collection.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

params.name: data
params.description: - the data of the document as JSON object

params.name: options
params.description: - an object with the following optional parameters:

props.name: createCollection
props.description:
- if set the collection given in "collection" is created as
well.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description: -  Wait until document has been synced to disk.

classitems.name: create

classitems.description: retrieves a document from the database

params.name: options
params.description: - an object with the following optional parameters:

props.name: match
props.description:
- boolean defining if the given revision should match the found document or
not.

props.name: rev
props.description: -  String the revision, used by the "match" attribute.

classitems.name: get

classitems.description: replaces a document with the data given in data.

params.name: data
params.description: - the data of the edge as JSON object

params.name: options
params.description: - an object with the following optional parameters:

props.name: match
props.description: - defining if the given revision should match the found document or not.

props.name: rev
props.description: -  The revision, used by the "match" attribute.

props.name: forceUpdate
props.description:
- If set an update is performed even when the given revision
does not match.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description: -  Wait until document has been synced to disk.

props.name: forceUpdate
props.description:
- If set an update is performed even when the given revision
does not match.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description: -  Wait until document has been synced to disk.

props.name: keepNull
props.description:
-  if set to false a patch request will delete every null value
attributes.

props.description: -  Wait until document has been synced to disk.

props.name: keepNull
props.description: -  if set to false a patch request will delete every null value

neighbors.

classitems.description: Imports data from a JSON Object.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

params.name: documents
params.description:
- The data to import, can either be one single JSON Object containing a list of
documents or a list of JSON Objects seperated ny new lines.

params.name: options
params.description: - a JSON Object containting the following optional parameters:

props.name: createCollection
props.description:
- If true, the collection will be created if it doesn't
exist.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description: -  Wait until documents have been synced to disk before returning.

props.name: complete
props.description:
-  If set to true, it will make the whole import fail if any error
occurs.

props.name: details
props.description:
-  If set to true or yes, the result will include an attribute
details with details about documents that could not be imported.

classitems.name: importJSONData

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
 in the connection is used.

params.name: documents
params.description:
- The data to import, The first line of the request body must contain a
 JSON-encoded list of attribute names. All following lines in the request body must contain JSON-encoded lists
 of attribute values. Each line is interpreted as a separate document, and the values specified will be mapped
 to the list of attribute names specified in the first header line.

params.name: options
params.description: - a JSON Object containting the following optional parameters:

props.name: createCollection
props.description:
- If true, the collection will be created if it doesn't
 exist.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description: -  Wait until documents have been synced to disk before returning.

props.name: complete
props.description:
-  If set to true, it will make the whole import fail if any error
 occurs.

props.name: details
props.description:
-  If set to true or yes, the result will include an attribute
 details with details about documents that could not be imported.

classitems.description: Creates a Cap Index for the collection

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

params.name: data
params.description: - a JSON Object containing at least one attributes:

props.name: size
props.description: -  The maximal number of documents for the collection.

props.name: byteSize
props.description: - The maximal size of the active document data in the collection.

classitems.name: createCapIndex

classitems.description: Creates a geo-spatial Index for the collection

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.	 *

props.name: fields
props.description:
- A list with one or two attribute paths. If it is a list with one attribute path
location, then a geo-spatial index on all documents is created using location as path to the coordinates.
The value of the attribute must be a list with at least two double values. The list must contain the latitude
(first value) and the longitude (second value). All documents, which do not have the attribute path or with
value that are not suitable, are ignored. If it is a list with two attribute paths latitude and longitude,
then a geo-spatial index on all documents is created using latitude and longitude as paths the latitude and
the longitude. The value of the attribute latitude and of the attribute longitude must a double. All
documents, which do not have the attribute paths or which values are not suitable, are ignored.

props.name: geoJson
props.description:
If a geo-spatial index on a location is constructed and geoJson is true,
then the order within the list is longitude followed by latitude. This corresponds to the format described in
http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#positions

props.name: constraint
props.description:
- If constraint is true, then a geo-spatial constraint is created.
The constraint is a non-unique variant of the index. Note that it is also possible to set the unique
attribute instead of the constraint attribute.

props.name: ignoreNull
props.description:
- If a geo-spatial constraint is created and ignoreNull is true,
then documents with a null in location or at least one null in latitude or longitude are ignored.

classitems.name: createGeoSpatialIndex

classitems.description: Creates a hash index for the collection collection-name, if it does not already exist.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: fields
props.description: - A list of attribute paths.

props.name: unique
props.description: -  If true, then create a unique index.

props.name: unique
props.description: -  If true, then create a unique index.

- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: fields

- Minimum character length of words to index. Will default to a server-defined
value if unspecified. It is thus recommended to set this value explicitly when creating the index.

classitems.description: Retrieves all indices for a collection

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

classitems.name: list

classitems.description:
Returns the result of an async job identified by job-id. If the async job result is present on the server, the
 result will be removed from the list of result. That means this method can be called for each job-id once.
classitems.name: put

classitems.description:
Returns the list of ids of async jobs with a specific status (either done or pending). The list can be used by
the client to get an overview of the job system status and to retrieve completed job results later.

params.name: type
params.description:
-  The type of jobs to return. The type can be either done or pending. Setting the type
to done will make the method return the ids of already completed async jobs for which results can be fetched.
Setting the type to pending will return the ids of not yet finished async jobs.

params.name: count
params.description:
-  The maximum number of ids to return per call. If not specified, a server-defined
maximum value will be used.

classitems.name: get

classitems.description:
Deletes either all job results, expired job results, or the result of a specific job. Clients can use this
method to perform an eventual garbage collection of job results.

params.name: type
params.description:
- The type of jobs to delete. type can be:
- all: deletes all jobs results. Currently executing or queued async jobs will not be stopped by this call.
- expired: deletes expired results. To determine the expiration status of a result, pass the stamp URL parameter. stamp needs to be a UNIX timestamp, and all async job results created at a lower timestamp will be deleted.
- an actual job-id: in this case, the call will remove the result of the specified async job. If the job is currently executing or queued, it will not be aborted.

params.name: stamp
params.description: -  A UNIX timestamp specifying the expiration threshold when type is expired.

classitems.name: example

classitems.description: This will remove all documents matching a given example.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description:
-   if set to true, then all removal operations will instantly be
synchronised to disk. If this is not specified, then the collection's default sync behavior will be applied.

props.name: limit
props.description: -  can also be set using the "limit" method in this class

classitems.name: removeByExample

classitems.description:
This will find all documents in the collection that match the specified example object, and replace the entire
document body with the new value specified. Note that document meta-attributes such as _id, _key, _from, _to etc.
cannot be replaced.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description:
-   if set to true, then all removal operations will instantly be
synchronised to disk. If this is not specified, then the collection's default sync behavior will be applied.

props.name: limit
props.description: -  can also be set using the "limit" method in this class

classitems.name: replaceByExample

classitems.description:
This will find all documents in the collection that match the specified example object, and partially update the
document body with the new value specified. Note that document meta-attributes such as _id, _key, _from, _to etc.
cannot be replaced.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description:
-   if set to true, then all removal operations will instantly be
synchronised to disk. If this is not specified, then the collection's default sync behavior will be applied.

props.name: limit
props.description: -  can also be set using the "limit" method in this class

props.name: keepNull
props.description: -  "false" will remove null values from the update document.

classitems.name: updateByExample

classitems.description: This will return the first documents matching a given example.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: skip
props.description: -   can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.

props.name: limit
props.description: -  can also be set using the "limit" method in this class

classitems.name: firstByExample

classitems.description:
This will return the first documents from the collection, in the order of insertion/update time. When the count
argument is supplied, the result will be a list of documents, with the "oldest" document being first in the
result list. If the count argument is not supplied, the result is the "oldest" document of the collection,
or null if the collection is empty.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

params.name: count
params.description: - the number of documents to return at most.

classitems.name: first

classitems.description:
This will return the last documents from the collection, in the order of insertion/update time. When the count
argument is supplied, the result will be a list of documents, with the "newest" document being first in the
result list. If the count argument is not supplied, the result is the "newest" document of the collection,
or null if the collection is empty.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

params.name: count
params.description: - the number of documents to return at most.

classitems.name: last

classitems.description:
This will find all documents within a given range. You must declare a skip-list index on the attribute in order
to be able to use a range query.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: skip
props.description: -   can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.

props.name: limit
props.description: -  can also be set using the "limit" method in this class

props.name: closed
props.description:
- If true, use interval including left and right, otherwise exclude
right, but include left.

classitems.name: range

classitems.description:
The default will find at most 100 documents near a given coordinate. The returned list is sorted according to the
distance, with the nearest document coming first. If there are near documents of equal distance, documents are
chosen randomly from this set until the limit is reached. In order to use the near operator, a geo index must be
defined for the collection. This index also defines which attribute holds the coordinates for the document.
If you have more then one geo-spatial index, you can use the geo field to select a particular index.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: skip
props.description: -   can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.

props.name: limit
props.description: -  can also be set using the "limit" method in this class

props.name: geo
props.description: -   If given, the identifier of the geo-index to use.

props.name: distance
props.description: - If given, the attribute key used to store the distance.

classitems.name: near

classitems.description:
This will find all documents with in a given radius around the coordinate (latitude, longitude). The returned
list is sorted by distance. In order to use the near operator, a geo index must be
defined for the collection. This index also defines which attribute holds the coordinates for the document.
If you have more then one geo-spatial index, you can use the geo field to select a particular index.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: skip
props.description: -   can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.

props.name: limit
props.description: -  can also be set using the "limit" method in this class

props.name: geo
props.description: -   If given, the identifier of the geo-index to use.

props.name: distance
props.description: - If given, the attribute key used to store the distance.

classitems.name: within

classitems.description:
This will find all documents from the collection that match the fulltext query specified in query. In order to
use the fulltext operator, a fulltext index must be defined for the collection and the specified attribute.

params.name: collection
params.description:
- The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined
in the connection is used.

props.name: skip
props.description: -   can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.

props.name: limit
props.description: -  can also be set using the "limit" method in this class

props.name: index
props.description: -   If given, the identifier of the fulltext-index to use.

classitems.name: fulltext

classitems.description: Set the amount of elements to skip for queries performed with this instance.

params.name: val
params.description: - The number of elements to skip.

classitems.name: skip

classitems.description: Set the limit for the result set for queries performed with this instance.
classitems.name: limit

params.name: collection
params.description:
- contains the list of collections to be used in the transaction (mandatory).
 collections must be a JSON array that can have the optional sub-attributes read and write. read and write
 must each be either lists of collections names or strings with a single collection name.

params.name: action
params.description:
- the actual transaction operations to be executed, in the form of stringified
 Javascript code.

params.name: options
params.description: - a JSON Object contatining optional parameter:

props.name: params
props.description: - optional arguments passed to action.

props.name: waitForSync
props.description:
- if set, will force the transaction to write all data to disk
 before returning.

props.name: lockTimeout
props.description:
- a numeric value that can be used to set a timeout for waiting on
 collection locks. If not specified, a default value will be used. Setting lockTimeout to 0 will make ArangoDB
 not time out waiting for a lock.

props.name: replicate
props.description: - whether or not to replicate the operations from this transaction.

params.name: edgeCollection
params.description: -  the edge collection containing the edges.

params.name: options
params.description: - a JSON Object contatining optional parameter:

props.name: filter
props.description:
- body (JavaScript code) of custom filter function (signature (config, vertex, path) -> mixed) can return four different string values:
- "exclude" -> this vertex will not be visited.
- "prune" -> the edges of this vertex will not be followed.
- "" or undefined -> visit the vertex and follow it's edges.
- Array -> containing any combination of the above.

props.name: minDepth
props.description: -   visits only nodes in at least the given depth

props.name: maxDepth
props.description: -   visits only nodes in at most the given depth

props.name: visitor
props.description:
- body (JavaScript) code of custom visitor function (signature: (config,
 result, vertex, path) -> void visitor). Function can do anything, but its return value is ignored. To populate
 a result, use the result variable by reference.

props.name: direction
props.description:
- direction for traversal.  if set, must be either "outbound", "inbound",
 or "any" , if not set, the expander attribute must be specified.

props.name: init
props.description:
- body (JavaScript) code of custom result initialisation function (signature
 (config, result) -> void)  initialise any values in result with what is required,

props.name: expander
props.description:
- body (JavaScript) code of custom expander function must be set if
 direction attribute is not set. function (signature (config, vertex, path) -> array)  expander must return an
 array of the connections for vertex.Each connection is an object with the attributes edge and vertex

props.name: strategy
props.description: - traversal strategy can be "depthfirst" or "breadthfirst"

props.name: order
props.description: - traversal order can be "preorder" or "postorder"

props.name: itemOrder
props.description: - item iteration order can be "forward" or "backward"

props.name: uniqueness
props.description:
- specifies uniqueness for vertices and edges visited if set, must be an
 object like this: "uniqueness": {"vertices": "none"|"global"|path", "edges": "none"|"global"|"path"}.

props.name: maxIterations
props.description:
- Maximum number of iterations in each traversal. This number can be
 set to prevent endless loops in traversal of cyclic graphs. When a traversal performs as many iterations as
 the maxIterations value, the traversal will abort with an error. If maxIterations is not set, a
 server-defined value may be used.

classitems.description: Creates a user.

params.name: active
params.description: - true if is the user is active.

classitems.name: create

classitems.description: Returns the requested user.

params.name: username
params.description: - the user to request data for.

classitems.name: get

classitems.description: Replaces entry for user
classitems.name: put

classitems.description: updates entry for user

params.name: active
params.description: - boolean is the user is active.

classitems.name: patch

classitems.description: deletes user
classitems.name: delete
